data.title: What Happened in July 1979
data.meta_description: What happened in July 1979. Browse historical events, famous birthdays and notable deaths from Jul 1979 or search by date, day or keyword.
data.text:
Historical Events

Sony introduces the Walkman, first popular portable cassette player

Jul 1 Stampede Pass, Washington is covered with 6" of snow

Jul 1 Sweden becomes 1st nation to prohibit "corporal punishment or other injurious or humiliating treatment" of children by their parents

Event of Interest

Susan B. Anthony dollar is issued, 1st US coin to honor a woman

Algerian ex-president Ahmed Ben Bella is freed after spending over a decade under house arrest

IRA bomb explodes in British consulate in Antwerp

Wimbledon Women's Tennis

Wimbledon Women's Tennis: Martina Navratilova successfully defends her title beating Chris Evert Lloyd 6-4, 6-4

USSR performs nuclear test at the Semipalatinsk Test Site in northeast Kazakhstan

Wimbledon Men's Tennis

Wimbledon Men's Tennis: Björn Borg beats American Roscoe Tanner 6-7, 6-1, 3-6, 6-3, 6-4 for his 4th consecutive Wimbledon title

Don Martina's MAN party wins election in Dutch Antilles

Jul 8 The Democratic Republic of the Congo adoptsa new constitution

Voyager 2 Spacecraft

Voyager 2 takes 1st ever photo of Jupiter's satellite Adrastea (J14)

A car bomb destroys a Renault owned by famed "Nazi hunters" Serge and Beate Klarsfeld at their home in France. A note purportedly from ODESSA claims responsibility.

Jul 9 Dr Walter Massey named director of Argonne National Laboratory

Jul 9 Voyager 2 flies past Jupiter

Music History

Chuck Berry begins 4 months term in prison for $200,000 in tax evasion

US Skylab enters atmosphere over Australia and disintegrates

Down With Disco!

"Disco Demolition Night" at Comiskey Park: fans go wild destroying disco records and cause the White Sox to forfeit second game of a doubleheader to the Detroit Tigers

Jul 12 Ian Paice joins Whitesnake

Jul 12 Kiribati (formerly Gilbert Islands) declares independence from the United Kingdom

Sports History

Calif's Nolan Ryan and Boston's Steve Renko each lose no-hitters in 9th

Faster

George Harrison releases single "Faster"

USSR performs nuclear Test

Morarji Desai resigns as premier of India

Jul 15 US Open Women's Golf, Brooklawn CC: Jerilyn Britz wins her first LPGA Tour event (and only major), 2 shots ahead of runners-up Debbie Massey and Sandra Palmer

Saddam Hussein Becomes President

Iraqi President Ahmed Hassan al-Bakr is succeeded by Saddam Hussein

50th All Star Baseball Game: NL wins 7-6 at Kingdome, Seattle

Jul 17 All star MVP: Dave Parker (Pittsburgh Pirates)

David Gower's Double Century

David Gower 200* in England score of 5-633 v India at Edgbaston

Anastasio Somoza Debayle Flees

Nicaraguan dictator Anastasio Somoza Debayle flees to Miami

Sebastian Coe's Record Mile

Sebastian Coe runs world record 3:49 mile in Oslo

Jul 17 Simone Veil becomes chairman of European Parliament

Gold hits record $303.85 an ounce in London

Jul 18 USSR performs nuclear test at the Semipalatinsk Test Site in northeast Kazakhstan

2 supertankers collide off Tobago-260,000 tons of oil spill

Jul 19 Maritza Sayalero, 18, of Venezuela, crowned 28th Miss Universe

Jul 19 Nicaragua Liberation Day; Sandinistas take over from Anastasio Somoza Debayle

Jul 19 Patricia Harris becomes sect of HEW

44-kg Newfoundland dog pulls 2293-kg load, Bothell, Washington

British Golf Open

British Open Men's Golf, Royal Lytham & St. Annes: Spaniard Seve Ballesteros wins by 3 from Jack Nicklaus & Ben Crenshaw; Nicklaus runner-up for record 7th time

Jul 21 National Women's Hall of Fame, honoring American women is dedicated in Seneca Falls, NY

Tour de France

66th Tour de France won by Bernard Hinault of France

Baseball Record

George Brett gets his 1,000th hit

Baseball History

Boston Red Sox Carl Yastrzemski hits his 400th HR

Paul Volcker Heads Federal Reserve

US President Jimmy Carter names Paul Volcker as Chairman of the Federal Reserve

109 cm rainfall at Alvin Texas (state record)

Estimated 109 cm (43") of rain falls in Alvin, Texas (national record)

Jul 26 Pioneer 11 transmits images of Saturn and its rings

"Broadway Opry '79" opens at St James Theater NYC for 6 performances

Jul 27 France performs nuclear test

Dave Kingman

Dave Kingman becomes 6th to have a 2nd 3 HR game

Jul 28 France performs nuclear test

Canadian Women's Open

Canadian Open Women's Golf (Peter Jackson Classic), St. George's CC: Amy Alcott wins by 3 from Nancy Lopez for her first major title

But Never Jam Today

Bert Keyes and Bob Larimer's musical "But Never Jam Today", based on the works of Lewis Carroll, opens at Longacre Theater, NYC; runs for 8 performances

Famous Birthdays

Forrest Griffin, American mixed martial artist (UFC Light Heavyweight C'ship 2008; UFC Middleweight C'ship 2011, 12), born in Columbus, Ohio

Diana Gurtskaya, Georgian-Russian pop singer, born in Sukhumi, Abkhaz, Georgian SSR, USSR

Joe Thornton

Canadian NHL center, (#1 draft pick Boston Bruins 1997; San Jose Sharks; Olympic gold 2010), born in St. Thomas, Ontario

Jul 2 Sam Hornish, Jr., American race car driver

Ludivine Sagnier, French actress (Swimming Pool), born in La Celle-Saint-Cloud, France

Jul 3 Sotirios Kyrgiakos, Greek soccer defender (61 caps; Panathinaikos, Rangers, Eintracht Frankfurt, AEK Athens, Liverpool), born in Trikala, Greece

Amélie Mauresmo

French tennis player (Australian Open, Wimbledon 2006; Tour Finals 2005; Federation Cup 2003), born in Saint-Germain-en-Laye, France

Jul 5 Shane Filan, Irish singer and songwriter (Westlife), born in Sligo, Ireland

Jul 5 Stiliyan Petrov, Bulgarian soccer midfielder (105 caps; CSKA Sofia, Celtic, Aston Villa), born in Mihaylovgrad, Bulgaria

Kevin Hart

American comedian ("Laugh at My Pain", The Secret Life of Pets), born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

Jul 6 Nic Cester, Australian musician (Jet), born in Dingley, Melbourne, Australia

Jul 6 Nicolas Daniel Maricio, Prince of Netherlands, born in Utrecht, Netherlands

Anastasios Gousis, Greek sprinter, born in Corfu, Greece

Jul 7 Carl Breeze, British racing driver, born in King's Lynn, United Kingdom

Ella Koon [Yun-na], Hong Kong Canto-pop singer and actress of Hakka heritage, born in Tahita, French Polynesia

Jul 9 Tolga Bedir, Turkish jazz pianist, composer, and arranger, born in Istanbul, Turkey

Gong Yoo [Gong Ji-cheol], South Korean actor (Train to Busan, Squid Game), born in Busan, South Korea

Éric Abidal, French footballer (Lyon, Barcelona), born in Saint-Genis-Laval, France

Craig Bellamy, Welsh soccer forward (78 caps; Newcastle United, Norwich City, Manchester City), born in Cardiff, Wales

Axel Teichmann, German cross-country skier, born in Saalburg-Ebersdorf, East Germany

Jul 14 Bernie Castro, Dominican baseball player, born in Santiago, Dominican Republic

Jul 14 Scott Porter, American actor (Friday Night Lights - "Jason"; Hart Of Dixie - "George"), born in Omaha, Nebraska

Alexander Frei, Swiss footballer

Jul 15 Laura Benanti, American musical theatre actress known for "Gypsy", born in New York City

Chris Mihm, American basketball player (Chicago Bulls), born in Milwaukee, Wisconsin

Jul 16 Jayma Mays, American actress (Glee, Heroes), born in Bristol, Tennessee

Brendan James, American piano player, and singer-songwriter, born in Derry, New Hampshire

Jul 17 Mike Vogel, American actor (Under the Dome), born in Abington Township, Pennsylvania

Deion Branch, American football player

Jul 18 Jared Hess, American film director and screenwriter "Napoleon Dynamite", born in Glendale, Arizona

Jul 18 Jermaine Paul, American gospel and R&B singer, winner of "The Voice" (2012), born in Harriman, New York

Jul 18 Joey Mercury, American professional wrestler for WWE, born in Fairfax, Virginia

Dilhara Fernando, Sri Lankan cricketer, born in Colombo, Sri Lanka

Jul 19 Luke Young, English footballer (Charlton Athletic), born in Harlow, England

Jul 19 Rick Ankiel, American MLB player (St. Louis Cardinals), born in Fort Pierce, Florida

Claudine Barretto, Filipino actress "Milan", born in Manila, Philippine

Jul 20 David Ortega, Spanish freestyle and backstroke swimmer

Jul 20 Miklos Fehér, Hungarian soccer striker (25 caps; Győri ETO, Porto, Benfica), born in Tatabánya, Hungary (d. 2004)

David Carr, American football quarterback (2002 NFL Draft: #1 pick Houston Texans), born in Bakersfield, California

Jul 21 Luis Ernesto Michel, Mexican soccer goalkeeper (7 caps; CD Guadalajara 252 games), born in El Grullo, Jalisco, Mexico

Jul 21 Tamika Catchings, American basketball player (Indiana Fever), born in Stratford, New Jersey

Lucas Luhr, German racing driver, born in Mülheim-Kärlich, West Germany

Perro Aguayo, Jr., Mexican professional wrestler (CMLL), born in Mexico City (d. 2015)

Jul 23 Ricardo Sperafico, Brazilian racing driver, born in Toledo

Anne-Gaëlle Sidot, French tennis player

Jul 24 José Valverde, American baseball player

Jul 24 Lee Si-yeon, South Korean actress known for "Sex is Zero 2", born in South Korea

Jul 24 Rose Byrne, Australian actress (Damages, Mrs. America, Bridesmaids, Neighbors), born in Sydney, Australia

Jul 24 Stat Quo [Stanley Benton], American rapper, born in Atlanta, Georgia

Jul 24 Valerio Scassellati, Italian racing driver

Ali Carter, English snooker player (World C'ship runner-up 2008, 12; World #2 2010), born in Colchester, England

Erik Westrum, American ice hockey player, born in Minneapolis, Minnesota

Jul 26 Mageina Tovah, American actress (Joan of Arcadia), born in Honolulu, Hawaii

Jul 26 Peter Sarno, Canadian ice hockey player, born in Toronto, Ontario

Jorge Arce, Mexican boxer (second Mexican to win world titles in 4 weight divisions), born in Los Mochis, Sinaloa, Mexico

Jul 27 Marielle Franco, Brazilian politician and human rights activist, born in Rio de Janeiro (d. 2018)

Birgitta Haukdal, Icelandic singer, born in Húsavík, Iceland

Jul 28 Lee Minwoo, Korean singer (Shinhwa), born in Namwon, South Korea

Karim Essediri, Tunisian footballer

Carlos Arroyo, Puerto Rican basketball player, born in Fajardo, Puerto Rico

Jul 30 Diva Zappa, American artist and daughter of Frank, born in Los Angeles, California

Jul 30 Graeme McDowell, Irish golfer (US Open 2010), born in Portrush, Northern Ireland

B. J. Novak, American actor (Inglourious Basterds), born in Newton, Massachusetts

Jul 31 Carlos Marchena, Spanish footballer and coach, born in Las Cabezas de San Juan, Spain

Jul 31 J. J. Furmaniak, American baseball player

Jul 31 Jade Kwan, Hong Kong singer, born in Hong Kong

Jul 31 Per Krøldrup, Danish footballer

Famous Weddings

British rock singer Marianne Faithfull (32) weds second husband British punk rocker Ben Briefly; divorce in 1986

Famous Deaths

Richard Ward, African American actor (Death of a Salesman, Beacon Hill), dies of a heart attack at 64

Jul 1 Vsevolod Bobrov, Soviet ice hockey left wing (Olympic gold 1956) and soccer striker (3 caps), dies at 56

Louis Durey, French composer, dies at 91

Lee Wai Tong, Chinese footballer, dies at 73

Elizabeth Ryan

American tennis player (26 Grand Slam doubles titles), dies at 87

Judson Laire, American stage and screen actor (I Remember Mama - "Papa"; Advise and Consent), dies at 76

Van McCoy, American musician and songwriter (The Hustle), dies of a heart attack at 39

Dalton Conyngham, South African cricket medium-pace bowler (1 Test, 2 wickets; Natal, Transvaal, Western Province), dies at 82

Charles Kynard, American soul, jazz, and funk Hammond B-3 organ player (Reelin With The Feelin'), dies at 46

Jul 8 Michael Wilding, British actor (Stage Fright, Courtney Affair, World of Suzie Wong), dies from a head injury at 66

Jul 8 Robert B. Woodward, American organic chemist (Nobel 1965), dies at 62

Jul 8 Sin-Itiro Tomonaga, Japanese physicist, Nobel laureate (b. 1906)

Betty Evans Grayson, American softball pitcher (National Softball Hall of Fame 1959; Chicago Queens), dies at 53

Jul 9 Cornelia Otis Skinner, American actress and writer (When Our Hearts Were Young & Gay), dies at 78

Arthur Fiedler, American orchestra leader (Boston Pops), dies at 84

Claude Wagner, French Canadian judge and politician, dies at 54

Kalervo Tuukkanen, Finnish composer, dies at 69

Jul 12 Minnie Ripperton [Andrea Davis], American pop, R&B, and disco singer-songwriter ("Lovin' You"), dies of breast cancer at 31

Corine Griffith, dies at 84

George De Witt, American TV host (Name that Tune), dies at 56

Gustavo Díaz Ordaz, Mexican politician (President of Mexico 1964-70), dies of cancer at 68

Alfred Deller, English countertenor (b. 1912)

Jul 16 James F Mcintyre, archbishop of Los Angeles, dies at 93

Doug Meintjes, South African cricket pace bowler (v England 1922-23), dies

Ludwig Renn, German writer, dies at 90

Mikhail Soschtschenko, Soviet Russian writer (The Regained Youth; Before the Dawn), dies at 83

Jul 22 Sándor Kocsis, Hungarian footballer (Budapest Honvéd), dies at 49

Jul 22 Tony "Two-Ton" Galento, American heavyweight boxer and actor (On the Waterfront), dies at 69

Joseph Kessel, French journalist and novelist (Army of the Shadows), dies at 81

Archie Duncan, Scottish actor (The Adventures of Robin Hood, Sherlock Holmes), dies at 65

Jul 24 Greg Davis, Australian rugby union flanker (39 Tests, 16 as captain; NSW, Drummoyne DRFC), dies from a brain tumour at 39

Ettore Manni, Italian actor (Street People, Divine Nymph, Fatal Desire, Heroes in Hell), accidentally shoots himself at 52

Jul 27 Shirley Mason, actress (Let it Rain, Dark Skies), dies at 79

Charles Shadwell, British conductor (BBC Variety Orchestra, 1936-46), and bandleader dies at 81

Bill Todman, American television producer (b. 1916)

Herbert Marcuse

German-American communist philosopher (One-Dimensional Man, Eros & Civilization), dies at 81

Beppie Nooij, Dutch actress and director (Red Sien, Zeemansvrouwen), dies at 60

Beatrix Lehmann, British actress (Candles at Nine, Staircase), dies at 76
